text: a boat full of creepy creatures from RL
Stein's Goosebumps books are brought to
life on the big screen in the movie
Goosebumps which stars Jack Black as the
famous horror writer I'm Jan and this is
10 things you probably didn't know about
Goosebumps to bring the movie zombie
like ghouls to life eight actors had
custommade flesh colored Prosthetics
applied to their faces the ghoulish face
Prosthetics were made from medical grade
silicon each set of Prosthetics took a
whole day to make and the ACT playing
the ghouls each needed a new set applied
every day as for the ghouls long fingers
1,500 of those were made by hand then
hand painted and brushed with clear nail
polish unlike the facial Prosthetics
each prosthetic finger could be used
three times from getting their
Prosthetics applied to dressing in hand
tailored vintage clothes it took each
ghoul 3 and 1 half hours to get ready
several of the actors playing the ghouls
already had plenty of experience playing
zombies as they'd worked on the TV show
The Walking
Dead if you're wondering what the hair
Department used to make Professor
shock's hair stand up on end it was
actually laundry
detergent to bring to life Slappy the
Dummy RL Stein's Alter Ego in the movie
a ventriloquist dummy was made by
Californian effects firm Iron Head
Studio his creature and costume design
has featured in The Avengers Godzilla
and The Hunger Games Mocking J director
Rob Letterman wanted Slappy's face to
resemble Jack Black in the movie as
black plays RLC Stein and also does
Slappy's voice on set Puppeteer Avery L
Jones controlled Slappy's movements and
scenes where Slappy walks were later
enhanced with computerized
effects according to Young Stars Dylan
manette Oda rush and Ryan Lee the
movie's creepiest character was the
clown especially because the actor
playing him never broke character on set
to turn per former Vivian Kyle into the
snake lady it took around 3 hours which
included applying fa and chest
Prosthetics airbrushing her hands and
fitting her skin tight metallic dress
the snake lady's eyes were made from
polarized sunglass lenses and could be
popped out easily during breaks and
filming as for her wig that took three
people 90 hours to
make the bog Monster Who's known as the
swamp monster in author RL Stein's books
was a late addition to the movie
creature special effects designer Steven
Prouty created the costume by hand
sewing thread that's used for camouflage
hunting uniforms onto fabric netting
actor Nate andr who plays the bog
monster in real life is married to
Vivian Kyle who plays the snake
lady the Egyptian priestess's eyebrows
are made up of hieroglyphics which spell
the word
Goosebumps the ice laad and wigs worn by
the movies Frozen people were made by
painting wigs with white and clear
culking or sealant from a hardware store
it took four weeks to create 14 wigs
which matched the actor's own hairstyles
as to the icicles that hang from the
Frozen people's faces they were made
using clear acrylics and vacuum formed
plastic although the movies werewolf is
a computer generated creation rather
than a practical effect a stunt
performer acted out some of its moves to
give the filmmakers a point of reference
for how the creature might
act according to visual effects
supervisor Eric nordby the most
difficult creature to create was an evil
poodle which only appears in six shots
in the movie The reason it was so
challenging is that it's extremely tough
to to make its tightly coiled fur look
real in CGI in fact it took the visual
effects Team Four to 5 months to perfect
its appearance now let me know in the
comments below who are your favorite
characters in Goosebumps and which are
your favorite books in the series if you
enjoyed this video do please share it
hit the Thumbs Up Button And subscribe
for loads more things you didn't know as
well as movie reviews and interviews
thanks for watching and see you next
time you P mov
lovers
[Music]
